intro: Physoplexis, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or purple flowers and hairy, broad leaves. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to several meters. Physoplexis species are often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
